misuse: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
description: The use of MD2 as a cryptographic hash algorithm is considered broken and should not be used. It is vulnerable to collisions and can be easily forged.
recommendation: Use a secure and up-to-date cryptographic hash algorithm, such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.

description: The use of hardcoded credentials in the code is a vulnerability as it can be easily discovered and used to compromise the system.
recommendation: Do not store sensitive data, such as credentials, in hardcoded form. Instead, use secure storage mechanisms, such as environment variables or secure configuration files.

misuse: CWE-757: Selection of Less-Secure Algorithm During Negotiation
description: The use of MD2 as a cryptographic hash algorithm is considered to be less secure than other algorithms, such as SHA-256 or SHA-512. This can lead to vulnerabilities in the system.
recommendation: Use a secure and up-to-date cryptographic hash algorithm, such as SHA-256 or SHA-512.
